# serval_app_resource_entitlement (Resource)



## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "serval_app_resource_entitlement" "example_app_resource_entitlement" {
  access_policy_id = "accessPolicyId"
  description = "description"
  linked_entitlement_ids = ["string"]
  name = "name"
  provisioning_method = "provisioningMethod"
  requests_enabled = true
  resource_id = "resourceId"
}
```

## Argument Reference

This resource supports the following arguments:

- `access_policy_id` (Optional) The default access policy for the entitlement.
- `description` (Optional) A description of the entitlement.
- `linked_entitlement_ids` (Optional) The IDs of entitlements that must be provisioned before this entitlement can be provisioned (prerequisite entitlements).
- `manual_provisioning_assignees` (Optional) The manual provisioning assignees (users and groups) for this entitlement. Only used when `provisioning_method` is "manual". Each assignee supports:
  - `assignee_id` (Optional) The ID of the user or group.
  - `assignee_type` (Optional) The type of assignee. Available values: "MANUAL_PROVISIONING_ASSIGNEE_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED", "MANUAL_PROVISIONING_ASSIGNEE_TYPE_USER", "MANUAL_PROVISIONING_ASSIGNEE_TYPE_GROUP".
- `name` (Optional) The name of the entitlement.
- `provisioning_method` (Optional) The provisioning method for the entitlement.
- `requests_enabled` (Optional) Whether requests are enabled for the entitlement.
- `resource_id` (Optional) The ID of the resource.

## Attribute Reference

This resource exports the following attributes in addition to the arguments above:

- `id` (String) The ID of the entitlement.

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

```shell
$ terraform import serval_app_resource_entitlement.example '<id>'
```
